column2: NC DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: North Carolina
column6: NC

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: exclusively for stop signs.
column6: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
column10: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.

column2: 2. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a cross road.
column6: a winding road.

column2: 3. This sign indicates:
column4: Double curve ahead
column6: Divided highway ends

column2: 4. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column6: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column8: The same as a green light.

column2: 5. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
column6: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column8: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.

column2: 6. This road sign is:
column4: a speed reduction sign.
column6: a guide sign.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn
column6: Left turns are permitted
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 8. This sign means:
column4: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column6: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column4: Warning: U-turn ahead.
column6: Hairpin corner ahead.

column2: 10. This sign means:
column4: Parking is not allowed.
column6: No parking on pavement.

column2: 11. This sign indicates:
column4: the entrance to a dead-end street.
column6: that you must yield the right-of-way.
column8: the entrance to a construction site.
column10: that you must not drive past this sign.

column2: 12. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column8: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column10: you are not allowed to park here.

column2: 13. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: On the right curb.
column6: As far to the right as possible.
column8: As close as possible to the center line.

column2: 14. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column6: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column8: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.

column2: 15. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column6: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.
column10: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.

column2: 16. Before turning, you should:
column4: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.
column6: give the proper turn signal.

column2: 17. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you cannot pass.
column6: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 18. Drive below the posted speed limit when:
column4: entering a highway where there are other cars.
column6: others drive below the speed limit.
column8: anything makes conditions less than perfect.
column10: you are on a four lane road.

column2: 19. Drivers may continue carefully through a yellow light if:
column4: they are turning right.
column6: they already are within the intersection.
column10: an emergency vehicle is crossing your lane.

column2: 20. Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
column4: yellow
column6: orange

column2: 21. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column4: look into the right side mirror.
column6: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
column8: look into the left side mirror.

column2: 22. Before backing up, you should:
column4: turn your head and look through the rear window.
column6: get off the car to see if it is clear to proceed.
column10: rely on your mirrors to see if it is clear to proceed.

column2: 23. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column4: prevents distractions from other vehicles.
column6: keeps other drivers alert.
column8: gives you time to react to situations.
column10: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.

column2: 24. Speed limit signs are:
column4: regulation signs (regulatory signs)
column6: service signs

column2: 25. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column4: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.
column6: It prevents skidding.

column2: 26. To avoid the risk of being involved in an alcohol-related crash, you should:
column4: say “No, thanks" if someone offers you alcohol.
column6: call a taxi if you've been drinking.
column8: decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.

column2: 27. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.
column6: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column8: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.
column10: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.

column2: 28. You must pull over to the edge of the road and allow an emergency vehicle to pass:
column4: only if the emergency vehicle is approaching.
column6: only if the emergency vehicle is following you.

column2: 29. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
column4: Do not move.
column6: Call the police.

column2: 30. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the type of route you are on.
column6: the speed limit on that route.
column8: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.
column10: that the route you are on might be dangerous.

column2: 31. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column4: Tranquilizers.
column6: Marijuana.

column2: 32. What are some telltale signs of a drunk driver?
column4: Weaving between lanes.
column6: Driving slower than the normal flow of traffic.

column2: 33. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: Reduced speed.
column6: Reduced visibility.
column8: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 34. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column6: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
column8: pass other vehicles and then stop.

column2: 35. Your blind spot is the area of the road:
column4: you see in your rearview mirror.
column6: you cannot see without moving your head.
column8: you see in your side mirror.

column2: 36. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column6: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column8: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.
column10: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.

column2: 37. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
